alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:46AM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 AM EST, emergency management reported extensive flooding in southwestern Piscataquis County from excessive runoff. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Greenville, Guilford, Monson, Blanchard, Elliottsville, Kingsbury Plantation, Frenchtown, Sangerville, Garland, Parkman, Abbot, Wellington, Shirley, Willimantic, Beaver Cove, Bowerbank, Kingsbury and Onawa. - The Piscataquis River at Blanchard has fallen to minor flood stage and will continue to fall but is causing rural flooding impacts in the area. Extensive road closures due to flooding in Southwest Piscataquis County. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
